page.title: 03Troutbeck village
page.content: Troutbeck village is peculiar in several ways. It has no obvious centre and the church is well away from the main settlement. It is strung out along the valley side, the main road by-passing it at the bottom of the valley. In fact, it is not really a village, more a succession of hamlets, with rough grazing and open fell above, and richer meadow below. The oldest, and finest building in the village is Townend, the former home of the Browne family. Dating from the late 16th century, it is now owned by the National Trust and open to the public. There are many 17th and 18th century buildings which were once farms and of which many have been converted to private use. A recent trend has been the conversion of disused barns in to homes.
